instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w
threads.message:
I've had 2 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards with this same issue.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w after liquid damage. 
Any tips would be much appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w
threads.message: Run ASD EFI (ASD 3S156), lets see if any error pops up, where was water damage???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w
threads.message: I'd say bad IO board or flat cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w
threads.message:
We've tried both I/O Board & Flat Cable. 
Didn't think about running ASD but will try that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Charges on 85w but will not charge on 60w nor 45w
threads.message: Did you check the sense resistors around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
